snippet: The New York State attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, said the suspects siphoned more than $850,000 over the years by creating fake driver’s licenses and checks.
abstract: New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman announces indictment of five people charged in an identity theft ring that stole more than $850,000 over several years; scheme involved tellers from several banks in the region stealing personal information from customers and using it to withdraw money from their accounts.
lead_paragraph: The New York State attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, said the suspects siphoned more than $850,000 over the years by creating fake driver’s licenses and checks.

headline.main: 5 Charged in Identity Theft Ring That Is Linked to Bank Tellers
headline.print_headline: 5 Charged in Identity Theft Ring That Is Linked to Bank Tellers
